name: Grandma's Southern Mac and Cheese
author: Rhett Towles
summary: This is my grandmother's macaroni and cheese recipe that we all crave and only get to have twice a year, if we play our cards right. Fairly simple and straightforward. The key is cooking time more than anything.
directions: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until tender yet firm to the bite, 8 minutes
Layer some of the macaroni in a 5-quart baking dish; top with a layer of Cheddar cheese
Continue layering macaroni and Cheddar cheese into the dish, ending with a Cheddar cheese layer
Beat milk, eggs, and mustard together in a bowl; pour over macaroni mixture, ensuring milk mixture gets to all of the macaroni
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and just before cheese around the sides gets crisp, 20 to 25 minutes
